item.title: 18 Popular npm Packages Hacked: 2 Billion Weekly Users at Risk
item.description: Incident On September 8, 2025, the npm ecosystem experienced a major coordinated supply-chain attack. A total of 18 widely-used JavaScript packages were compromised with malicious code designed to intercept cryptocurrency transactions in browsers. These packages collectively see over 2 billion weekly downloads, making this incident one of the most impactful attacks in open-source history. Affected packages include: ansi-styles@6.2.2 debug@4.4.2 chalk@5.6.1 supports-color@10.2.1 strip-ansi@7.1.1 ansi-regex@6.2.1 wrap-ansi@9.0.1 color-convert@3.1.1 color-name@2.0.1 is-arrayish@0.3.3 slice-ansi@7.1.1 color@5.0.1 color-string@2.1.1 simple-swizzle@0.
